column5: Anyone play online here?  If so PM me and I will give you my gamertag!
PM Sent!  Too bad Rapala Tournament Fishing is not an online game!  Tony
I'm still playing with the xbox..maybe when I get a HDTV I will switch to the xbox 360  I hope the new ghost recon comes out on the regular xbox..I like my modd chip and big hard drive
No such luck Terry, you want the new games have to get the X360..  I prefer Ghost Recon on the computer, the Xbox version was very crappy..  Go HALO II
Mines AbBoTtRoS.  I play Tiger 07, NHL 07 and a few others on LIVE.  360 is a great system!
Booo! NHL 07, you should have bought NHL 2K7, it's a better hockey sim than NHL 07, plus you get Harry Neale as a commentator  Those darn yanks can't call a hockey game for the life of them.  Tony
Does the US version have the puck that comes with the red streak so they can see it..
Hey what about Rick Jeanerette.......that guy even gets Cherry and Mcleans' attention
I'm surprised more people don't play the PC games, you can get controllers just like Xbox, play the same games with better graphics and you don't have to buy a Xbox ?
I doubt a computer game has better graphice than xbox360....but you never know! Guys my gamertag is  steelhead7845...add me as a friend if you want!

GB, I can sit my lazy ass on the couch and enjoy the explosions on a 42" T.V. when I play, instead of being hunched over a keyboard and 19" monitor.  Also, I never have to worry about upgrading my graphics card, or RAM to play the latest game.  Don't even get me started on installation times, driver searces, and updates/patches  I used to play Counterstrike tons on the PC, but it is much more enjoyable playing games on the surround sound set-up.  Tony

Yes, I can see the advantages on the 360, but the PC definitely has better graphics if you have a good graphics card and tons of ram. You can hook you PC to a big screen TV to if you wanted with a wireless keyboard and controller, lol.  I've played the 360 and have compared graphics . The 360 will eventually just be a PC anyway,lol, every year it just gets closer to a computer, with more ram, Internet capabilities etc..  I guess Bill just wanted something a little different to sell.  Oh, and my PC is hooked up to a sterio system to for the surround sound.
